name: CitySpur
tag_list: local-business-directory, hyperlocal, listings, premium-yellowpages, regional-marketing, geo-targeted
overview:
CitySpur is an online business directory which creates listings for the best local establishments in a city.

CitySpur’s goals is to take the guesswork out of the online Yellowpageâ€™s experience. The company’s review staff travels around the country and places businesses and services in top 10 lists for every major business category (e.g. attorneys, restaurants, etc.). Placements are awarded by a combination of:

  • Conducting Interviews with the Businesses Directly.
  • Meeting with Area-Specific Journalists.
  • Tallying Online Reviews.
  • Tallying submissions on the website by users

How to Use the Site

CitySpur creates a new site for every city, e.g. San Diegoâ€™s site can be found at: SanDiego10.CitySpur.com. A user can simply type this into a browser or can find a city on the National City Directory.

Once at a city site, you can find the top businesses in that city using several different methods:

  • Type a Business or Business Category into the Search Bar located at the top right hand corner of the site.
  • Using the Navigation Bar, simply roll your mouse over the main category and the sub-categories will automatically drop down.
  • The Homepage, our most searched business are located throughout the homepage.

CitySpur also broadcasts a weekly travel show, the CitySpur Spotlight. The company’s spokesperson, Allison Davis, reviews the best restaurants, hotels, family activities, etc. each Friday afternoon. The show can be found on each page throughout the site along with Youtube and Blip.TV.
